moves.1. e4: ZIM 36. Tied at 4.5 in Round #1 closed dragon??  Funny it eventually opens up on the e-file.
I didn't like the look of DSB just sitting there hemmed in on e7 so I decided to fianchetto.  Computer thinks it's a terrible idea and white should give serious thought to d4.  White eventually played a strong defense with 8.d3.
moves.6. O-O Bg7 7. Re1 O-O 8. d3 Bd7 9. e5 dx: Thanks to the computer I see that 11.Bf4 would have been an annoying preface.  At any rate, the stage is set.
moves.11... Qxd7 12. Re2 a6: 12.Re2 was weird and I knew it but couldn't figure out how to take advantage of it.  Computer says 12...Nd4 (clears the way for my Q to protect the b-pawn move to 5th rank without ...a6) 13.Re1 b5 advantage.  The text is still not too bad because I was seeing something similar, just a little slower.
moves.13. Be3 Nd4 14. Bxd4 cxd4 15. Nb1: I would think Nd4 is obviously better but the computer doesn't agree.  Hmmm....?
moves.15... b5 16. Bb3 Rfd8 17. Qe1 Qc6 18. Nd: I never would have seen it but computer is looking hard at 21.Rxe6 fxe6 22.Qxe6+
moves.21... Rde8 22. Re4 Nb6: Game note "22...Nb6 wants to return to d5 though 24...e5? I blundered too focused on getting my N to a good position and thought I'd strengthen my central pawns in the meantime. I didn't realize ...exd4 pawn re-capturing his N leaves my rooks unprotected to a discovered attack from his R battery. So now I'm thinking to move my K out of the LSB way which I knew would be trouble. Then I can reinforce the e-pawn. But there's also his N hanging if I threaten his R with ...Nf6. Hmmmm which one? 23...Nf6 my e-pawn is still OK so I'll go with that one."
moves.23. Qd2 Nd7 24. Rae1 e5: I wanted to line those pawns up better but I miscalculated as shown by his 25.Nxd4.  Good eye!
moves.25. Nxd4 Nf6 26. Nf3 Nxe4 27. Rxe4 Qc7 2: Game note "29...h6 hate to play this because my K is out of position now (want it beside my R) but I think I'm OK if he plays Nxf7 I reply ...Re7 and his N is trapped."  Indeed the computer shows the same, but funny it evaluates that as better than the retreat to f3.
moves.30. Nxf7 Re7 31. Nxe5: Big turning point that I didn't realize at the time.  Better is 31.Qg4 +0.00 or 31.a4 Rxf7 32.Bxf7 Qxf7 33.axb5 +0.16.  Computer now shows -2.59.
moves.32... Rxe5 33. Qf3+: 33.Qf3+ didn't see that but I've got my R and Q lined up for mate.
moves.33... Ke7 34. Qf7+ Kd8 35. Qf8+ Kd7: Game notes "35...Kd7 please take my R lol. 37...Qd6 I guess the threat of mate will pass with 38.f4 39...Rf8 his Q is pinned."  Anyway it's all over baby blue.
